Tar då detta en gång för alla. 

Installation Guide for Jedi Acadamy:

1. Begin with mount the first "image" file: rzr-ja1, with deamon tools (a.k.a. D-Tools).

2. When the installtion begins just follow the instructions (as usual).

3. When the installation asks for CD2, mount rzr-ja2 instead and continue the installation.

4. When the insatllation is finish, mount CD1 again (rzr-ja1). Then open that CD with Explorer (utforskaren). On the disc there  is an directory named Razor1911. Inside that directory there is a file (the crack file). Copy that file and put it in the "GameData" directory in /installdir/Jedi Acadamy and overwrite the existing file. 
(Default SWE: C:ProgramLucasArtsStar Wars Jedi Knight Jedi AcademyGameData )
(Default ENG: C:Program FilesLucasArtsStar Wars Jedi Knight Jedi AcademyGameData)

5. Then start the game! CD1 should always be mounted in order to play the game. The game crack isn't a "NO-CD Crack".

To clashman (and others who have problems with getting CD2 to work): only mount one image at a time. To install the game and not get errors with CD1 or CD2 do this:
- mount image 1
- start install
- unmount image 1
- mount image 2 at same drive letter as image 1 was mounted
- continue installation
- unmount image 2
- mount image 1 again at same drive letter as image 1 was first mounted

and then use the crack file.

Vart är cracken?

Guys Guys Guys,
Mount the FIRST image using some freeware program.
Install it.  It'll get half way thru and ask for the 2nd disk.
Now mount the 2nd image on the same drive.
It'll complete the install, and then ask for the first disk again.

Then in Windows Explorer, goto the mounted drive and copy jasp.exe from the Crack directory, and use it to replace the file in the GameData install directory
e.g.
C:\Program Files\LucasArts\Star Wars Jedi Knight Jedi Academy\GameData

Then it will all work fine.

If your machine is hanging at the command line black window after starting the game, then you probably don't have the right version of Direct X.

Choose HELP from the main menu and then click "Analyze Your Computer".  this will tell you if your machine has whatever is required to run the game.

Just installed it and it's working a treat!
